intro: Conyzella coulteri, commonly known as Coulter's conyzella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in dry conditions. The flowers are small and yellow, forming dense clusters that attract various pollinators.
